dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 949 IH: Hatchie River Wild and Scenic River Study Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kustoff introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate a segment of the Hatchie River in the State of Tennessee for study for potential addition to the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Hatchie River Wild and Scenic River Study Act of 2025.

subsection.text: Section 5(a) of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act (16 U.S.C. 1276(a)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The approximately 163-mile segment of the Hatchie River from the Mississippi-Tennessee State line to its confluence with the Mississippi River.

subsection.text: Section 5(b) of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act (16 U.S.C. 1276(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Not later than 3 years after funds are made available to carry out this paragraph, the Secretary of the Interior shallâ€”

clause.text: complete the study of the segment of the Hatchie River described in subsection (a)(147); and
submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report describing the results of such study.

subparagraph.text: In carrying out the study of the segment of the Hatchie River described in subsection (a)(147), the Secretary of the Interior shall identify opportunities to administer such segment in partnership with State, regional, local, and community stakeholders.
